title: Worked Solution
text: The slope of a line is given $$by$$ the formula: $$slope=\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ Plugging in the coordinates given, we get: $$slope=\frac{3-\left(-1\right)}{\left(-5-2\right)}$$ Simplifying, we get: $$slope=\frac{4}{-7}$$ Simplifying further, we get: $$slope=\frac{-4}{7}$$ So the slope of the line that passes through the points $$(2,-1)$$ and $$(-5,3)$$ is $$\frac{-4}{7}$$.
